Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Fan916
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location of this hotel. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. No bath tub- just a shower stall, but it's NYC after all- you take the good with the bad. However, don't bother paying more for a king size bed when it's just two twin beds pushed together, just go with two doubles or a queen.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - cool boutique stay in a big big part of the City”
Reviews.Author: Ebtnc
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying here on a business trip but will be back for personal (and business). I got a great corner room. Very clean, courteous staff, cozy feel but next to the major attractions of Rockefeller Center and Radio City. The East Village is my fab part of the city but this is where I'll stay when needing to be uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: osirees
Reviews.Content: Rockefeller center and Radio City music hall is right across the street and Central Park and Times Square are just couple of blocks away. In terms of location it doesn't get better than this. Ok, not true. There are Hiltons and Marriotts right in the middle of Times Square but it would cost you an arm and a leg to stay there. I got a standard room for 170 a night on a Presidents Day weekend. The price is reasonable considering all the adjacent hotels nearby are all 250+. The room was spacious enough, bathrooms clean, free wifi and the linen was clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I didn't dine there but they do have a restaurant at the 7th which might come in handy. I couldn't get my TV to start and called the reception at midnight and a tech came right away. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because there is club 'Johnny Utah' right next door. It's almost like they share the same entrance. Because of this there is always a group of party-dressed people assembled at the entrance and also at around midnight there was always a large trash cart in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “All that was expected and more”
Reviews.Author: jsm2go
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters are practical business hotels, not flash but comfortable and practical. I stayed in a standard room and found that this was the best of the brand I have yet visited. Comfortable , bright , helpful staff and a great work/restaurant on the 7th floor. This is a small property and I was in two minds whether to recommend it as I'm worried that I'll struggle to find a room next time I want to visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Yankees15
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Easy walk to great restaurants and theaters. Room was small, but comfortable. Staff at check in was very helpful and polite. Only complaint was the noise coming from a bar at street level. Could hear the bass from bar music and a lot of shouting and noise coming from people on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: pasowine
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Club Quarters before so I was expecting the somewhat small rooms. The room I stayed in was quite nice, however, and made use of the little space, as it was laid out well with bed, TV, desk. I even had a slight view looking north. The room was very clean and modern and much better than other similar Manhattan places I've been at the same price. I always like the way Club Quarters has refillable filtered water bottles at your convenience. There was a small restaurant on the 2nd floor with a nice outdoors area, as well as a library, and a business center where you could also print airline tickets. Everyone was quite friendly, and when you step out on 51st Street you are right near so many places. Starbucks just around the corner and Rockefeller Center just across the street. The only issue was the elevators - which were very slow. Easy auto check-in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of midtown”
Reviews.Author: ddefilip
Reviews.Content: There is no waiting to check into the Club Quarters. Their modern check in system enables you to get your room key as quickly as you can type. The front desk is very helpful if you need them. The elevators are not too fast, so give yourself some extra time if you need to get somewhere in a hurry. The rooms are small, but they are always clean. The temperature is very comfortable- something I find extremely important in NYC. If you need a bite to eat, they have a lovely restaurant with a view. The only downside to this hotel is that their mattresses are not keeping pace with the soft sleepers on the market. It is an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, slow internet”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We arrived fresh off the plane to the hotel. They made us very welcome on our arrival. The rooms were clean, neat and quiet, although small. But in fairness all hotel rooms in New York appeared to be on the small size. We had a queen bed, but I found the bed to be slightly too short for me (I'm 174 cm tall) with my feet hanging off the end. We checked with the hotel and apparently this is a standard size and they had no other option. The hotel provided wireless internet, however this was extremely slow, to the point of been useless. There were no in room safes, although they do have safety deposit boxes at reception that can be organised on arrival and are easy enough to use. One very big positive to the hotel was the availability of bottled water. On our level (17) there were empty bottles provided which could be filled with the free chilled filtered water that was provided. After the hours of walking we did each day, this was a very welcomed facility in a hotel. Overall the best thing about this hotel was its location. If you are looking to be in the middle of just about everything, this is the place. As soon as you walk out the door, the Rockefeller centre is across the road, Radio City Music hall is on the corner, and Time Square is approx a 5-8 minute walk. We didn't use the restaurant so cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value!”
Reviews.Author: mitochi
Reviews.Content: I have also stayed at the Club Quarters Midtown and if I would need to chose which one is better I would say this one is better located, but the Midtown is a bit more spacious. In any case very good business hotels and surprisingly clean and in good shape for NY hotels. I would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Q
Reviews.Content: Great location directly opposite the Rockefeller Centre. We were there at the time of the tree lighting and we just had to walk across 51st Street to see it. Our room was small by other standards but not a bad size for New York. Most importantly it was clean. Staff were freindly and efficient. We tipped the maid a couple of dolars a day and she even left a note to thank us which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marb84
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC twice yearly and this is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in NYC. The location was excellent. In most hotels in NYC the rooms and dated but this hotel was modern and fresh. The bed was very comfortable. There was also drinking water on the corridors which meant not buying water every day. I asked for a fridge and got a new one which was brilliant. The cleaning and reception staff were all very helpful and friendly. I was on the 24th floor which means I didn't hear any traffic or noise of any kind. There was free Wi Fi in the bedroom and also if you wanted to print anything is was free which sometime you have to pay for in other hotels. The only negative thing was that there was a gale force draft in under the door which meant keeping a towel at the bottom of the door while you were in the room. I noticed that the other rooms on the floor had towels and blankets outside their doors so it wasn't just me that had this problem. I wouldn't let this put me off and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “mixed”
Reviews.Author: vets17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from times square and nex t to the shopping at fitfth avenue. Hotel is small but functional. No satellite television so limited choice and a problem with the viewing ( bad quality) Rooms are cleani and a great option is the terrace bar were you can get free coffe and thee. For smokers this is excellent as you can smoke on the outside terrace. The bad. EXCESSIVE in hotel costs. We made a long distance call ( to washington) and they charged us 58 dollars for 15 minutes. . A small beer in the restaurant is 9 usd. Its cheaper to drink beer on times square. Overall not bad.

Reviews.Title: “GR8 SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: SDR05_11
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time during our stay here. The staff was so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: vbarcelona
Reviews.Content: I was working at Rockefeller Center for the week, so the location was very convenient. The noise wasn't that bad, however the worst part was having only 2 elevators to the entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Diamond6_inPA
Reviews.Content: Too many things wrong to list them all: first, don't expect to get ANY sleep. There is no sound proofing, so be prepared to hear the all-night club on ground gloor, the people on the street, the garbage trucks, etc. Also, we froze to death...heat didn't work. Only two elevators...and one was out of service....so be prepared to hoist all your luggage up and down the stairs. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: abadilife
Reviews.Content: I always stay here whenever all the rooms at the Waldorf or Barclay are all booked. It is a decent place and I always have had a positive expereince there. It is very clean and the staff is very helpful. The only issue I had is whenever i ordered breakfast, they would forget something. The location is great as it is right across the street from Rockefeller Center and very close to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dayspring J
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is a sure bet for tasteful, convenient, safe accommodation in the very heart of the cities where it has branches. I'm a regular client of the London branches so wanted to give a NYC branch a try. It was just what I'd come to expect - helpful, comfortable, with an absolutely incredible location a few steps from Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue, and Radio City. Couldn't have been in a better place, really. The staff was very pleasant and helpful every time I saw them and made our stay very easy, including giving good directions around town and ordering us a private car when we asked for one. There was free internet access and printing for boarding cards- very thoughtful. The restaurant closes relatively early, so we never made it there - too busy seeing the city! - but there are takeout menus in the rooms and we ordered a great pizza from Ray's right to the hotel. Rooms are a little small, yes, but that's New York, space at a premium. We received only a couple coffee sachets in our room at first, but after leaving a note to the staff requesting more, we soon had more coffee than we could drink! Thanks for the good service.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: loverbunny
Reviews.Content: I realize hate is a very strong word but I had to use it here. This hotels claims to be one that is geared towards business travelers, not! The rooms are extremely small. If you are claustrophobic, forget about it. If you prefer to use wireless internet, forget about it. It sucks. This hotel should be ashamed of themeselves. They kept telling me that they were going to reset their routers when all along they knew their wireless internet sucks. Oh, and don't try and pick up other wireless networks cause it ain't happening. This hotel has well over 20 floors but guess what? There are only 2 elevators. Yes, that's right ladies and gentlemen, only two snail speed elevators. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again if someone paid me to. One thing I will say is, if you don't mind the small rooms and you don't need the internet, it's a great location for the Christmas tree lighting service and rockefeller center.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: foofighter1981
Reviews.Content: They really should rename this place Club Quarters Rockefeller Center: it feels like it's part of the complex. As most of the reviews here are spot on, I'll just highlight some areas: -Can't emphasize the brilliant location enough, esp for tourists. Rockefeller Center downstairs; walking distance to Central Park, Grand Central Station, Times Square, etc. and plenty of subway stations nearby to access other areas -Compact but clean, comfortable, modern rooms (love the shower) -Slow, spotty internet access (couldn't hold a Skype video call on an iPad)... but hey, it was free so shouldn't really complain -Friendly, efficient, knowledgeable check-in staff -Clear, b&w early check-in / late check-out policies (with relatively reasonable prices) -Big drugstore nearby that has plenty of provisions -Just a personal touch: J. Crew and Banana about a minute walk away, in case you get mud on your shirt ;) This was my first real trip to NYC, so I booked a SuperShuttle to get here... in morning traffic, it took about an hour from JFK to the hotel front door; not too many stops on the way, only the Waldorf-Astoria and Hyatt Grand Central came first in my case. While this wasn't necessarily a bad experience, I'd probably consider taking the train here next time.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not happy with resturant an bar tipping policy”
Reviews.Author: cb107
Reviews.Content: W e stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago, and were pleased with everything but the resturant and bar. We had bad weather one night and ate in. We were charged with a couple of things we did not order, and even though there were only 4 of us, we were charged 18% tip. The service was NOT good, and I did not think that was quite fair. Also, one night, we went up to the bar before turing in, for a nightcap. Again, we were charged a 18% tip, even though we went up to the bar( they did not come to the table) and took the drinks to the table ourselves. I did not think this was at all fair, because they did nothing other that pour the wine! Be aware of this before you go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HH51
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, fairly updated hotel just a block from Rock Center. I have stayed in many smaller rooms. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room--not huge but not tiny. Also there was a microwave and mini fridge. Next door is a diner for a quick meal. There is a big drug store down the block, where we bought a foldout map that was very helpful. The rooms were quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: KaushikGurgaon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in midtown Manhattan and is close to the important tourist spots like Tijmes Square and Rockefeller Center. You will also find varieties of restaurants at walking distance. Of course that comes at a price. The room rate was expensive. Also the room was small but neat. I tried the breakfast one morning but there wasn't many dishes to try. I didnt take the breakfast after that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wooferine
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - perfect. Had a queen room for 2. Bigger than I thought and we were on the 22nd floor (2207) overlooking the corridor to 30 Rock skating area. I was afraid of the room location due to getting such a low rate but was pleasantly surprised. I did hear more noise than usual from kids at 3am (?!) to some snoring next door but it was not a real bother. You can fill up empty plastic bottles with water by the elevators but there's no ice. Towels/toiletries underneath the water area. Very pleasant staff helped with subway maps and directions. I would definitely stay here again if I can snag a great rate again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff, terrible food mediocre room, great location”
Reviews.Author: deepestBlue22
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive, amazing location. It is also right next door to Teresa's, a nice little breakfast place that is very cheap and everything is freshly made to order. The staff was incredibly poorely trained, rude and uninformed. The room was supposed to come with a "free" breakfast, but the restaurant on site refused to accept the certificate that was given to us for our stay. We instead ate at Teresa's. The room had very high ceilings, but it seemed dirty and in the middle of a snow storm the heat did not work properly. The maintenance was prompt but housekeeping never sent extra blankets that were requested. They also advertised complimentary bottled water and gym equipment in the room, but after check in they informed me they no longer do that. The bed was not comfortable. I am mostly disappointed in less than truthful advertising and overall lack of organization when running the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieBelle24
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location! The hotel is right across from Rockefeller Center and down the street from Radio City Music Hall. The walk to Times Square and Broadway was short and easy. You are also close to all the great shops along Fifth Avenue. The room was small, but had a desk, microwave and mini-fridge. I loved the convenience of the restaurant and lounge on the 7th floor. The view from the terrace was great, the food was good, and the service was excellent. I would definitely stay here again if in NYC for business, but it would be a tight squeeze for a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Always happy with Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: Tresadla
Reviews.Content: Im never disappointed with Club Quarters and this is a lovely little hotel, home from home right slap bang in the middle of all the action. Firstly, I have stayed in some pretty impressive hotels in New York over the years and to be honest the snootiness and slow service drives me insane. I like to just come and go as I please and if that is what you like then this little secret haven is for you. Funny crazy bar next door - Johnny Utah's, which we went in for a nightcap most nights before retiring. Although there is a restaurant and terrasse on the 7th floor, we didnt use it, took a quick look and its very nice. I love breakfast in the deli's and there is a fairly decent one a couple of doors down for those toasted bacon/cream cheese bagels hmmmm!! Complimentary wifi and each floor has bottles of free water (from a dispenser) for you. Lovely clean bedroom and bathroom and comfy beds. A little piece of happiness on West 51st Street and 5th Avenue, the location is perfect. Would also like to add that I slept like a baby here, our room was on the 16th floor and very well sound insulated, didnt wake up at all. Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Bondgirl70
Reviews.Content: As a former New Yorker, I am always asked for advice on places to stay in the Big Apple. Thankfully, I am able to test some of my recommendations, as I travel to the city on business or family visits fairly often. Stayed here,as my company recommended it via our travel unit, as its across from Rockefeller Center. Location is ideal. Nice neighborhood..but that's it. There is no valet when arriving in this busy block, so you must drop bags off, then go and park car yourself. Several smoking patrons from the bar next door, was loitering in front of the hotel entrance when arrived, which was sort of not cool. No help offered to us when using self check in. No guide on what the hotel offers or what's available in area, like other hotels do. Elevators very slow. Must use key for entering guest room floor, as many business men are in and out of the tiny lobby to use the business center/restaurant on 7. Standard room was very small, even for NYC standards. Bed was uncomfortable, no view, and bathroom has a sliding glass door that doesn't close. (If you're shy and have a roommate, it's not for you.). HVAC was spotty. TV remote for tiny LCD TV broken which we replaced while there. While it IS clean, there were several stains of splattered mysterious liquids on bathroom walls and door. Wireless access while free (YEA!), was spotty at best. While the floor service people (who bring pillows, replaced remote batteries etc), were kind, we were VERY disappointed over finding a room service charge on our bill upon checkout for something we did NOT order. The night before we left, we stopped at an Italian place on 6th, and ordered two pasta dishes to go, while having a drink at the bar. When we returned to eat in our room with our takeout, (as husband was feeling ill), we found one of the dishes to NOT be what we ordered at all. Immediately called restaurant (PAZZA NOTTE BTW), the hostess apologized and said they would deliver the proper order to our hotel asap. We provided our cell number and room number, so they could call us when they arrived and we would swap the wrong order with the new, correct one. Well, one hour later, a Club Quarters service person knocked on our door, to deliver the new dish. We asked where the restaurant delivery person was and he said that they left. I then gave a cash tip to the service man and offered the dish we were to swap out since would not be eating it and in case the restaurant returned looking for it. He was happy to take it and left. Apparently, the hotel decided to charge OUR bill for this dish, as the deliveryman failed to tell them it was a swap. We also were charge a room service charge for the hotel to bring it to us. We never ASKED for anyone to do this and we never authorized this charge. When we checked out, we had to wait for the hotel to look into this. calling the restaurant, waiting for their answer etc. While we were annoyed, we were patient and respectful understanding that the day clerk was trying to figure it out. Finally the hotel clerk decided to remove it from the bill and let us go on our way saying: "I'll take it off for now, so you can get out of here, but we'll still have to look into it and get proof from the restaurant that you already had paid for it." Seriously? Luckily I have a bill so I can fight this charge if needed, but honestly, it left a very bad taste in our mouth as a departing guest. As a result, we won't return, or recommend this hotel. For the money ($300 per night with all tax and BTW an extra person charge for our room!), there are many better hotels around..such as Dream, Royalton, etc. A big disappoinment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location next to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Just stayed there for a long weekend with my wife and was not disappointed at all. The rooms are nice size, very clean, with a newer bathroom. The bathroom is rather small but very functional. The rooms could be more sound proof. We heard the alarm in the room next door go off every morning. The staff was very friendly and they have a nice area on the 7th floor with a restaurant and outside terrace. Would definitely stay there again as the rate was very competative with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Juerg
Reviews.Content: My first visit to hotel with automated check-in and -out. My room was clean and up-to-date with free Internet, WiFi and a renovated bathroom (always a plus in NYC). Free water bottles are available on even floors. The two elevators reach capacity quickly - not only when laundry is transported on and off the premises. Good restaurant on the 7th floor with outside terrace. If you sit next to the edge you can see what is going on at Radio City Music Hall. Close to all kinds of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: sdwho
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a one-night stay in NYC. Very helpful staff; good location in mid-town, small, but well appointed room; numerous amenities (including free bottled water!) Definitely a hotel I'll be returning to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “ben montreal”
Reviews.Author: benmar123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took my grandaughter for her first visit to New York city, the hotel located between 5th & 6th aves directly accross Rockefeller Plaza is perfectly located. We were in a suite that was quite comfortable, with a kitchenette which was handy. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The garage is nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good hotel if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Miguelmms
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and my 2 years old daughter in a vacation trip. We got a good rate through Expedia for a superior room with kitchenette. Pros: very well equipped rooms with queen bed plus a sofa bed, microwave, fridge, dishwasher and free internet. Cons: poor sound insulation in the rooms, matress and slow elevators (although not always). Best of all is the location. I definitely stay at this hotel again if a get good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdfan
Reviews.Content: Moved here from their sister hotel when the phones there went out. This is a hotel of excellent value in a terrific, central location. Well-trained, professional staff. The hotel does a good job of providing amenities in the room that satisfy most needs, and they will quickly provide other necessaries, e.g., shaving cream. The towels were a bit threadbare for what I would have expected. They have a machine down the hall that provides chilled filtered water that flows at a very slow pace into plastic bottles they supply. Nice touch, but it takes a while to fill the bottles. The bar was very nice and had a good view. Comfortable bed. My room had a sensational view. It did not have a minibar, which was a surprise, but when I inquired, they brought one within a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: vintagebabe67
Reviews.Content: My frined and I satyed at this hotel on our 1st trip to New York..We loved it, the location was perfect. We walked everywhere, to the theater district, Time Square, Rockfeller Center was cross the street. If interented to the "Today Show you are only a block away. The room was well appointed and lager then we thought being this was New York. Room had a micro and ref. with a sofa bed. We had penty of room. WE were on the ams floor as the restarant. I can't say enough about this hotel. Woudl stay there again and would recommond this to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: australianangel
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Lifts were slow at times and it has a very small lobby. We stayed in a one room suite with kitchenette. We found the staff unfriendly and unapproachable.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in midtown Manhattan... great service... great rates...”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadtoomuch
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is a terrific hotel chain. Yes, the rooms are small, but do you really go to NYC to spend time in the hotel? No! The rates are usually competitive if not lower than comparable hotels in midtown. What cannot be beat, however, is the quality of service you get from Club Quarters -- ANY of the locations! The staff are friendly, helpful and eager to please. Yea, you check in/check out yourself, but it's not a big deal. While any of the CQ hotels are good deals, the W. 51st Street has a comfortable and convenient lounge on the 7th floor for drinks, a quick meal or just relaxing with a paper. And you're within a few steps of Times Sqaure, Fifth Avenue shopping, and Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel - We Keep Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: C-Pat21
Reviews.Content: We most recently stayed at the Club Quarters opposite Rockefeller Center in December 2010, but also stayed there in December 2009. We love to visit NYC at Christmas time, and this hotel is the perfect launching point for seeing the sights and lights. The rooms at the hotel are not large, but you have to undestand that in NYC space is at a premium. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and there is enough room for a crib as we brought our infant son this past visit. The hotel staff has always been very helpful and pleasant, which is one reason we keep coming back. The other reason, and definitely the best thing is its location. You are literally in Rockefeller Center. At Christmas we love walking out the front door and being right there by the tree. You are also only a few blocks from Time Square, Central Park, Trump Tower, and all the wonderfully decorated windows. I'm not sure you could find a better location than this.

Reviews.Title: “Basic comforts but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ddefilip
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter, you get the feeling it is you and the building. There is an automated check in process and up to your room you go. This can be wonderful when you are in a hurry and someone is talking to the front desk. Only one person works the front desk and if you are lucky enough to be there when this one fellow is working, you are greeted with a smile. Otherwise it is like checking into a pod in a new age society. Elevators have security, but often you have to insert your room card 5 or 6 times to get it to work. The pillows make sleeping difficult and don't expect a nice dreamy bed, only the basics here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: CamillaW2
Reviews.Content: The room wasnt the most spacious you'd ever find , if you're doing a lot of shopping :) but it was fine for two people as you're not actually spending most of your time at the hotel. It was neatly decorated and had AC. The bathroom was clean and had a nice shower. The hotel is situated perfectly, the street beneath almost noise free and only a couple of blocks from Times Square. The personel were very friendly and helpful. It has its own restaurant with a tasty breakfast and terrace with an excellent view There really isnt anything negative to say about this hotel, I'd recommend it to anyone going to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Business and romantic getaway... superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Chili-Bite
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location... need we say more. Preferred property to the midtown CQ and service seemed to be a notch or two better. Would stay here again for proximity to everything NY.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs on this trip”
Reviews.Author: mikenco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Nyc for our 7th anniversary last week.I researched hotels on TA,and elsewhere for months.I found this Club Quarters to fit everything we were looking for in terms of location,price ,free internet,restauraunt on premises,and it'smostly all positive reviews.I was helped at auto-check in by staff,who were very accomodating with every request,and spoke to us everytime we went by.Lobby is not large,but not an issue at all for us.Key card must be used to operate elevator.The room was very clean,with a good bathroom and a great flat screen,and desk area . Air conditioning was ice cold and in perfect working order.The bed was firm,but ok.We had only 2 pillows,and they brought us more within 5 mins.of our call. Restaurant was a pleasant outdoor terrace,and the food was good,if not a tremendous selection.We would return here,but we're gonna stay down town on our next visit,to possibly another club quarters location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice locale, but better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Moenique
Reviews.Content: Believe I made the mistake of basically paying full price while booking through my company's corporate membership website, but this was a long-awaited pleasure trip and wanted to minimize any potential problems that might arise. Wanted a room with twin beds to ensure comfort, had even agreed to paying an upgrade charge when called to reconfirm the request. The self-service check-in does not give any indication of the room assignment, only produces an estimate of charges and spits out the electronic room keys. Upon finally arriving at the room, it was an extremely small single, one double sized bed and a rollaway crammed behind the door - there would be no way to exit the door if the rollaway was unfolded! Went back to the check-in kiosk/front desk and the cordial attendant finally admitted they overbooked, the requested type of room was not available, but there was absolutely no offer of a reduction in rate. The small room did face the front of the building and there were windows that actually opened for fresh air, which was a nice feature, so we decided to stay put at that point and simply had the rollaway removed. Admittedly, the hotel and room itself was very clean, and appeared well-kept, but quirky. There were exactly two hangers (his and hers??) in the small closet, and when housekeeping finally replenished the towels after two nights' stay (had to formally request the service) they only replaced one set (??). Oh well, NYC was fun anyway and plan to return soon, just not to Club Quarters...

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: arpillai
Reviews.Content: Right from the get go, this was a great place. Granted the first room offered was small, on the second floor, window next to some HVAC equipment, facing the inner courtyard. Could not stand the thought of staying there for five nights, so asked Dean, the unflappable concierge, and he was gracious. Dean is an asset to that hotel, by the way. We got a room, much nicer and airier up on the top floor, 27th floor (room number 2706). It does not face 51st street, but from the window, I can see the street, as well as the Rockefeller Rink. Perfect. The room was very clean, bathroom was very good. No fridge or m/w etc.. Coffee maker and hair dryer is standard. Decent toiletries. Cool fact: they provide free chilled water from coolers, on some floors, bottles included. That must have saved us a bundle. Two elevators, and they can be busy at peak times, but served us well. Free PC's to use in mezzanine floor. Right next door - Teresa's Diner is not to be missed for some of the cheapest breakfasts/lunches, but the best tasting, with great service. How does a 3 egg omelet with country style potatoes and toast for 5 bucks sound, in Midtown Manhattan? I can't get that here in St.Louis for 7 bucks. There are other food places around, 30 Rock is right next door, everything is close enough. Central Park is about .75 miles, may be. We ran almost every day there. There is a gym, but we did not use it. Overall, we highly recommend this place, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: blulightning747
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on Hotwire a few weeks before the trip and I'm glad we did. It's classed as a 3.5 star and I'd say that's about right. The room is fairly nicely sized for NYC but there's no wardrobe, only a pole with around 6 or so coat hangers. Thankfully some were brought along so it wasn't a problem. There is some drawers as well where you can store other things so it's not a huge deal, just be aware. The bathroom was nicely sized and had a walk in shower and nice furnishings. The shower was an average flow but always had hot water so absolutely no complaints from me! I was in room 309 and there was no real view to speak of. I don't care about that, while it's nice to have you don't spend any time in your room anyways! The staff were lovely and always made an effort to say hello/goodbye when you were in the lobby, which was nice. Check in was smooth as well but I wish they wouldn't ask you to use the self check in, they didn't work for one gentleman and I could see him losing his patience. There is free WiFi and cabled connections in the room but the WiFi was terribly slow. It was better on the 7th floor on the terrace but forget about Skyping if you have a smartphone, it's just not fast enough. The cabled connection is much better though, bring an Airport Express and make your own network from it! The location is excellent. Rockefeller Center is literally across the street and there is some nice delis just down the road. I'd also recommend heading down the two blocks to 9th avenue where there is some amazing food on the 45-50+ streets plus lots of bars. The photos already posted are accurate of what you'll get so there's no point in me putting anymore up. The one really negative point about this hotel though is the elevators. There is only two and they go up 25 floors. It's really annoying as they can take a very long time during the busy periods, so be prepared. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RUGQQFY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location in Manhatten. One block from 30 Rock, across the street from Radio City Music Hall, only a couple of blocks from Times Square one way, and one block from 5th avenue the other way. Was a wonderful stay, hotel was accomodating, had free bottled water on vaious floors - which was great. Husband and I were there for long weekend for 15 year anniversary and were able to find our way around the area in no time. Rooms were on the smaller side, but we were not in it very much, and hotel and room was very clean and friendly! We had a room on the top floor and had a great view looking down the avenue. This is a great hotel in a great location for those travelling to Manhatten for any reason!

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand negative comments - awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DonVitto69
Reviews.Content: Got this room @ Hotwire for $127 per night. Midtown, Rockafeller Centre. It should have been a dump for that price and location. What we found was a modern, tastefully decorated and well appointed room. Service was comprehensive, responsive and friendly. Here are my biggest complaints: TV was a bit small, king bed would have been nice and so would a hair dryer in the bathroom (my wife). Yeah, those three things are the worst I can say about the place. If you get the chance, stay here: full service hotel for a motel price - right where you want to be in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Room for Manhattan/Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters was not my first choice for accommodation at this trip but proved to be a very good experience. The room I had was very large for NYC and included a microwave and small refrigerator. It was very comfortable. It had no view to speak of but was quiet and allowed for excellent sleeping despite it being on a very low floor. The hotel is minimally staffed at all times, but that didn't affect my stay. There was a false fire alarm in the early morning hours on my check out day which the front desk handled well - they did not immediately evacuate but did keep guests informed as they searched to confirm it was a false alarm, which it was. The only downer was the car service arranged to Newark Airport. Two front desk clerks quoted a price of $70 including tolls but the driver that morning when I went to pay him quoted $70 plus $8 for tolls. The front desk needs to work with the car service on rate information for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cudnikdar
Reviews.Content: The location is great, clean rooms, warm hospitality, discreet service and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located, comfortable and great value accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 0_Cabin_Fever4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited New York to take part in the Marathon. We were looking for a room well located near central park which was the finishing point, and Club Quarters met this requirement as well as our budget. The check-in process was nearly fully automated, but we needed a little help with the system which was kindly offered. The rooms are a little small and dated, but clean and well appointed, and in reality good value for money. Despite the position, I was impressed at how quiet the room was, which was great as we were sleeping all hours due to jet lagg. The concierge organised us a car to the airport, and looked after our baggage for the day (at no cost unlike another NY hotel I stayed at). In all, a great value place to stay at that I would certainly go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable size for two people, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: KMone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in midtown - not on a very busy street, but easy walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, and subway stations. I paid about 60% of the going rate, and might have been less satisfied if I paid full price, but the room was big enough for hanging out in the evenings, the room was clean and well-lit, the bathroom was nice with a well-designed shower, and there was a mini-fridge and microwave. The wireless was so slow I gave up using it, but there was a hard ethernet connection that worked well. There was a security guy outside late at night to verify that anyone entering the building had a room key, and this key was needed to get the elevator to work. Also, there were free water bottles and purified water to refill them.

Reviews.Title: “Membership Racket - DO NOT Patronize this establishment”
Reviews.Author: TravelCoordinator201
Reviews.Content: This is a total racket to get expensive membership dues out of you. DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL. I spoke with their group reservations team for a group of 15-18 travelers and was told repeatedly that they had room and that we could get a non-member rate of approx. $30 more than member rate per room ($259). I communicated to our travelers to book their rooms only to be told that when they called they were told there was no availability. After a total run-around, I was told "oops, those days are blocked for members only and you have to become a member." Mind you that these plans were made one and a half months in advance. I found their practices to be dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everywhere in midtown!”
Reviews.Author: cckone
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right at Rockefeller Center, bus and subway one block away. The rooms are small (think cruise cabin size) and kept very clean, bathroom with pocket door with decent amenities and walk-in shower, no tub. Free wired and wireless internet is a plus. The Terrace Club on the 7th floor is open to hotel guests and outside members serves a good Continental Breakfast for $11 ++ and American for $16++ which then includes scrambled eggs and hot meats; as well as lunch and dinner . The bar is open till 10:00PM and is well attended. Right next door are 2 coffee shops for casual meals and easy take-outs. The front desk staff is helpful despite working in a small area and many people asking for keys, help, directions etc. And the area can be noisy, the Radio City Music Hall loading dock is across the street so trucks can be loading or unloading at any hour of the night causing noise. The double paned windows block most of it though. Overall a good choice if one can get this at a discounted rate - if you have to pay full rack, try elsewhere especially if you prefer a larger room than this hotel can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BobMurray
Reviews.Content: I got this room for a week on hotwire for a deep discount (about $105 a night) and I was extremely surprised at the quality of the hotel, the cleanliness, the quiet nature of the room and overall comfort of my stay. I would highly recommend this hotel for any vacation or business travel. Convenient because subway is right across the street and within walking distance if your in town for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: clarissy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and extended my trip to include a weekend. The hotel has great weekend rates which make it a good NY option and location is very good for shopping, rock centre and St Patricks. We had a superior room which was pretty good, however the bed wasn't the most comfortable and the street outside is very noisy. Price could drive me to stay here again but its not the most exciting place. The gym is good as is the free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Construction Ruined the Stay”
Reviews.Author: aaaaa
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters itself was fine, but during some of my stay the front of the hotel was a construction site. To enter the hotel, one had to walk a metal plank over a sunken part of the sidewalk. Then, on my first morning I was abruptly awakened by extremely loud construction, including the use of a jackhammer, performed directly in front of the hotel. Upon leaving and entering the building, I saw and felt particles blowing around, and some even entered one of my eyes. To minimize the noise while entering or exiting the hotel that morning, it was necessary to hold one's hands over one's ears. The hotel receptionist was even wearing a dust mask on her face, and conversation with her was difficult at best. Hotel guests were given no notice of this situation, either in advance or during the stay, and were offered no compensation. So, though the facility was quite nice, I can't recommend the hotel as of now.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good No Frills Business Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RJFlyer
Reviews.Content: A client with a corporate membership put me up at this hotel on multiple occassions during the holiday season when other hotels double or triple their rates. Typically, you must have a membership to stay during weeknights, but the property is open to the public on weekends. The property is located in the heart of Rock Center, just one block north of Rock Plaza. It is convenient to all of the Midtown venues, shopping and businesses. The rooms are well sized for New York and the work stations are excellent. There is a club space with an outdoor patio that overlooks Rock Plaza and Radio City Music Hall. Because the hotel is designed for business travelers, the lobby is tiny and you won't find the normal ambiance of typical hotel. However, the location, cleanliness and value of the property cannot be beat. Typically I would not stay at a Club Quarters on a leisure trip with my spouse, but this property is the exception to that rule. Note: this is a much better property than the Club Quarters Midtown located on West 45th.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ilovechristmas1121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my life-long dream trip to NYC at Christmastime. We chose Club Quarters opposite Rockefeller Center because it was close to the Tree at Rockefeller and out of all of the reviews that I read the negative comments were few and far between. The price was reasonable. I had read in the reviews that the rooms were small but that didn't matter to us because we wouldn't' be spending that much time in the room. When we arrived, the check-in kiosk wasn't working and the person at the desk was more than willing to help us. Very nice and friendly! We got to our room and it was perfect. 15th floor, very clean, quiet, perfect! We could look out our hotel window and to our right we could see Radio City Music Hall and to our left was a few decorative trees that went down the path to the Tree. They had complimentary bottled water on the floor above and below us which was convenient. Also. the room was big enough for us. The bed was very comfortable, very cozy. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect location. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and friendly. We will be staying here again when we go back to NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lala1302
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very basic hotel, as others have noted, but it is in a fabulous location. It is across the street from Rockefeller Center, and only about a 10-15 minute walk (depending on the crowds and how fast you walk) from Times Square, Grand Central Station, and Central Park. The room was not huge, but I didn't think it was a small as others have described. 3 of us stayed in a room together, and although it was tight at times, it was not unbearable. We were not in the room much at all though. The elevators are slow, but we only had to wait during the times many people were leaving, such as dinner time or check in time. The staff was very nice, and the rooms were clean. The sliding bathroom door was different, but it wouldn't keep me from staying here again. We were on the 3rd floor , so there was some street noise, but not as much as I thought there would be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - uninspiring no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: AusBusinessTraveller
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, which is superb. The room was ok in size, but hadn't been cleaned properly. The room faced the street and so was noisy, but this is no surprise for NY. The breakfast area was poorly run and the hot food was lukewarm, so I ate breakfast out each morning. There's no lobby, just a couple of ATM-styled check-out machines a few chairs and a small desk for someone to check people in. I was there five days for work and had a much better experience when I stayed the last time in NY at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location !!!”
Reviews.Author: martinmatousek
Reviews.Content: ...as a New York Virgin, I was glad I chose Club Quarters. Nothing can beat the location and it's in walking distance practically to anything you want to see. Check in a bit weird and kind of ATMish .-). Takes just couple of minutes. Lifts fast and always when I needed them. Rooms are very small and dark, but clean and comfy enough. Not for long stay. Bathroom very small, but again clean and good enough. Room was quiet as well. Two blocks ( 5min) rightway is very nice deli-buffet supermarket with tasty and affordable food ( especially handy for quick breakfast ) and pharmacy. Rockeffeler Ice rink and 5th Av just seconds away. If I will go to NYC again ( and I will !!! ) I will choose different place, because already know the place a little bit. But if you go first time and need comfy bed...there is hardly better place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tiznow13
Reviews.Content: So the room is tiny and the hotel may not offer the amenities you'd expect at a larger more full service destination and it's expensive - you can't ask for a better location and who spends much time in the room anyway - you're in NY, NY! The self-service check-in and check out was a breeze and they had luggage service so I left my bag with them during my business meeting. The restaurant on the 7th floor is nice and offers outdoor seating. The self-service water bottle filling stations were unique. My room was comfortable and clean resulting in a good night sleep. The hotel is two blocks from the subway stop at 5th and 53rd - take the E train from Jamaica Center if u fly into JFK. The hotel is two blocks from Rockefeller Center, three from Times Square, two from MOMA and on and on. Plenty of sites, shopping and restaurants within a few blocks. There's a great bakery on the corner of 6th and 49th - Magnolia i think - great cupcakes and sweets and it's open early and late.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters has the best value in Manhattan, and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zedduli
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters opposite Rockefeller center has a perfect location, central Manhattan just a step from 5th avenue, with St Peter's and high-end shopping. The room was clean and stylish, a little small but the low price made it so worthwhile. The bathroom was sparkling. The room was very quiet, and the mattress was so wonderfully comfortable, we slept extremely well. I would recommend Club Quarters to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a girls holiday”
Reviews.Author: kfor83
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here for a girls holiday. Location is second to none, right beside rockefeller, subway and a short walk from central park. The room wasn't massive especially as there were three of us in it but wouldn't expect a large room in NYC. There was a double bed and a sofa bed, noise wasn't an issue for us (we were on the 6th floor), the water fountain is located in the gym and on the 7th floor where the terrace is. There are safety deposit boxes at the reception if required. The rooftop terrace looks nice, we were unable to eat there as there is a dress code, no flip flops allowed! With three of us staying in the room, we often hadn't been left enough towels and had to frequently ask for more, that was our only complaint really. Staff were plesant and accomodating and check in/out was speedy.

Reviews.Title: “No frills...but awesome location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at a Club Quarters it was in San Francisco some years ago, and so when I was more or less forced into booking here, I was not thrilled. Not that there is anything wrong with the quality, but the room in San Fran was small. So when I booked this, I was expecting the worst. What I got, was surprisingly nice. Checking in was, to be nice, a major challenge. The lobby is exceptionally small, and there is no real "desk" but a checkin kiosk. When I was met by the staff to check me in, they tried, but at 2:00 PM (on a Monday afternoon - holiday) the room was not ready. I was asked if I would mind checking back in about twenty minutes...which I did. I did this three more times and was FINALLY able to check into the room at around 3:45. Now, I need to note that I didn't have to wait in the lobby. They checked my bag, and I headed across the street to Rockefeller Plaza and found a nice bench in the shade and got some work done. Not at all a bad way to spend an hour. The room...it was small...I'll not kid you. But it was clean. The furnishings were modern, the bathroom (usually the worst part of any hotel) was spotless, and the bed...well, let's just say I didn't want to get up. While the onsite restaurant and bar is recommended by many, I was not in the mood to get dressed up in business casual attire, so I opted to walk to dinner...some 31 blocks, to one of my favorite restaurants that is frequented by locals called Regional Thai. I'll review that later, but if you want a fun place to watch all sorts of people, this is THE place to go. Anyway, the only real downside I could find to the entire stay was the lack of an ironing board and iron in the room. You had to call for one, which they brought right up, but it is something that I didn't want to dress to receive...but as not to shock the bellman, well, you know. One nice plug that I will the Club Quarters is the free bottles of water. Seems like a small thing, yet to be able to not only get a bottle or two, but also to refill your own bottle from the dispenser...really a nice touch. When you take the location of the hotel into account, along with the rate, and the people, I have to honestly say that this will be my new hotel when in NYC...even if I was going to bring my wife. Clean, comfortable, reasonably priced and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Showing our 13yr-old NYC”
Reviews.Author: LVioletD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, we didn't need many services, as we were sight-seeing most of the time. Though we did enjoy the Terrace for drinks,one dinner & breakfast-it was great. Our room had it's regular queen bed for my husband & I and a good pull-out sleeper/couch for our daughter. We had a small refrigerator, coffee-maker & microwave. The only down side was, as our room was on the 2nd floor and at the front of the hotel...the next door Johnny Utahs is rocking and a hot spot for fancy cars. We weren't so much hearing the bar noise, but the people & autos coming and going on the street till ~ 2AM Fri. & Saturday. I often bring ear-plugs when I travel, so was glad I had them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: travelling55
Reviews.Content: We booked on name your own price, Priceline and got for $160 a night which was amazing. We had to ask for a wheelchair accessable room after we booked as my husband broke his foot. We were put in a real wheelchair accessable room complete with wheel in shower which was great. There is a microwave and fridge in the room and cutlery and dishes for when you order take out etc. You can walk almost everywhere, and if not the subway and bus is a block away. The lobby is almost non existant, we had to ask if this was the hotel, but that was okay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiorgioP5
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in end of August. This is more a residence than a hotel. There is very little service even though when I needed help it was very efficient and friendly. The check-in and check-out process is done through an automatic teller machine, but the girl at the desk offered to help each time and everything went through smoothly. The room is very comfortable, the closet for clothes is small, but I was by myself. The internet access is very good: you get WiFi and a Ethernet cable in case the signal is poor. The bathroom is simple and very clean. Each even floor has a fountain with fresh filtered water and plastic bottles to fill. The best thing is the proximity to Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue, Sixth Avenue, Central Park, MoMa. The stores and dining concourse under Rockefeller Center are very handy and connect to the subway. You are in the heart of the city surrounded by some of the nicest buildings in town. The least interesting part is that lively restaurants and night life happens mostly south in the Village or near Union Square. But this is only a few subways stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: Miss-Kaur
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel was close to all the major attractions and streets. The service was poor, but the hotel was clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises - good service”
Reviews.Author: MatthewB6283
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small, it was exactly what I want in a NYC hotel: clean, cool and quiet. Out until late and the A/C didn't work when got back after midnight - called for service and they had it swapped out for a new unit in less than 15 minutes (wow!). Tiny lobby is crowded and makes you worry that you'll be waiting for desk service, but they are very efficient. Free wireless, but terrible signal strength.

Reviews.Title: “Service poor! but convenient & clean”
Reviews.Author: onemorepet
Reviews.Content: You don't have to pay this much to get a comfortable hotel in NYC. The restaurant closes to early for a business traveler who would like a glass of wine after dinner. When I finally convinced them to open the terrace, the waitstaff never managed to bring me my glass of wine. I was unable to find a valet to bring my suitcases upstairs or from whom I could get directions. I had a hard time get cellular service here.

Reviews.Title: “Close, Convinient, Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: devgre
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here during a trip to Manhattan to see MUSE at the Walter Kerr Theater. We were greeted by a very sharp staff that were helpful in every way they should have been. Our room was small but effeciently designed and was very comfortable. We chose to be "typical" NY tourists and as we rode the subway and walked everwhere having free water bottles on site is a major plus! It's location is ideal as it's only a stones throw away from Time Square, Radio City Music Hall and The Rockafeller Center! The biggest plus to me was that although it was so close to all the hubub it is quiet and somehow still feels very exclusive and secluded! I would reccomend this to anyone looking for a comfortable place for two or a group of friends that are traveling together. As it is smaller and does not have many "family oriented" amenities I wouldn't recomend it to those with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good location”
Reviews.Author: travel49424
Reviews.Content: I opted not to go for a Times Square location and I'm glad picked this hotel. Pros: - good price - good clean room - GREAT location; walk across the street to Rockefeller center. Better location than a Times Square hotel (not as crazy busy!) - close to major attractions like Times Square, Broadway theatre, etc - great deli next door (omelette, toast + hashbrowns for $4.00!) Cons (very few) - breakfast not included - no bathtub

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL of a find! GREAT location! Prices are RIGHT! You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: keldot
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights. Can not beat the location at Rockefeller center. Very clean and modern rooms, all have been updated. Pleasant staff, small unassuming lobby (if you can call it that). Free bottled water if you go get it in the workout room. Ice machine also, although only available on 1 or 2 floors, you can go get it. Felt very safe and secure the entire stay, elevators are keyed. House keeping is good and keeps a very low profile. More of a home-type feel, aka no-frills. Dinning is up to you. The upstairs Terrace is very nice and business casual daytime, more formal at night. Johnny Utah's is great and full of entertainment, from the live band to the mechanical bull riding, food is good also, highly recommended and is a favorite hangout for yuppies after work Monday through Thursday. Our Best find was Theresa's Cafe right next door also...very good food, quick., and cheap by new york standards. Over all we were pleased with our choice of hotels and the stay. I was traveling with my mother and my 15 year old daughter so we used the sofa bed. The bedding was very comfortable and met our expectations. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: MelbPk
Reviews.Content: I was looking for accommodation for the 4th July weekend and given there are so many options available it is hard choice. I decided on a few criterias: 1) close to Central Park (I intend to visit the Museums) and Times Square 2) Reviews 3) Price Using these criteria, I finally decided on Club Quarters, Rockefeller Centre but was still a bit concerned with the choice I made. To my surprise, I believe it is a little gem. It is close to everything and worth the money. The room is a small but I am not complaining as I was not not planning to stay in the room all day, so it is not an issue. Check in / out was a breeze. I thought Club Quarters has a nice little touch - there was a complimentary water cooler on each floor (not sure if others have the same as this was the first time I stayed in NY).

Reviews.Title: “Would look for alternatives”
Reviews.Author: Bettsi
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a terrible experience at all but we had several problems. If you are looking for ANYTHING but the basics, go elsewhere. I will say this is the best location to attend the Today Show and/or Rockefeller Center events. There is a huge Duane Read pharmacy down the street which was very handy. We had problems with our bathroom toilet. In fairness, it was addressed and fixed rather rapidly. There were two of us, so we were kind of hoping for more than one hand towel and bar of soap. We had to ask for these (they were given to us, but only on the day we asked). We didn't have an iron or ironing board. There also was not a room safe. There is no ice service. There are "chilled" water stations on every-other floor, but the water is not cold. The t.v. was fine, the bed was comfortable, and the room was basically clean. In the heat wave, the a.c. worked well. I have stayed at better places, but also at worse. For the price, this was okay, but I will look for an alternative next time. In the end, there was an extra $20 "extra person" charge because there were two of us. This was strange because I booked the room for two.

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ScottDrakeISU
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here June 11 - 13, 2010. I was very, very impressed with the property. I scored a room at $155 a night on Priceline. I asked twice on the phone before I arrived for two beds. Club Quarters isn't really a two-bed style property. It's a business hotel for people who are oftentimes going to be in town for several days. They're generally not positioned as leisure properties and therefore wouldn't generally have two beds. When I arrived the dude at the front desk kinda chuckled when I requested again a room with two beds. (I really thought there would be a handful.) He said he'd deliver a roll-a-way. It arrived before we made it up the elevator. The elevator is sometimes annoying. There are two for a 25+ story bldg. Sometimes it can take awhile. Location is great. You're right there at Rockefeller Center and only 2.5 blocks from the nearest subway entrance. It's very easy walking distance from Times Square and the Theatre District. Rooms are tiny, but it's Manhattan. If you didn't know the rooms would be small you didn't do your homework. With the roll-a-way there was almost no room left, but it worked. Our room had WiFi free, a desk, a small flat screen. What we didn't have in the room but needed was an iron and ironing board. That was disappointing. I'm currently writing this review from a crappy room in a crappy hotel in Ohio -- but they have an iron and ironing board in here. That said, the pair was delivered immediately. Staff all spoke English really well and I think everyone spoke English as a first language. Everyone we encountered was more than friendly. Their general friendliness was a big part of the reason that I clicked this rumor so high. The bathroom was great for Manhattan. It's small, but not tight. There's a restaurant under the hotel that has a mechanical bull. The restaurant seemed cool, but my cousin said drinks were $13. I don't know if that was true. I just watched the folks on the bull. Overall, you wouldn't go wrong at all staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: statetrooper61
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters at the Rockefeller Center is a quite new hotel of the chain. Rooms are as in every Club Quarters equipped with free Wifi and directl dial phone which makes it perfect business trips as well as the central location. I booked a room with a kitchenette as bothing else was available. Everything was perfect and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and right across from Radio City”
Reviews.Author: tktktktktk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights over the Victoria day long weekend. The front desk staff seemed a bit bored, but we were able to drop off our bags early without any problems. Check in and check out were easy. The room is quite spacious compared to two other hotels i've stayed at before in Midtown. There were only six (i think) rooms on this (19th) floor. The bathroom is clean! Didn't care for the toiletries they had in bathroom. I'm a light sleeper and the only noise i heard one night was the door opening and closing from another room. And if you are a light sleeper i'd suggest sleeping on the side of the bed away from the bathroom. The center of the bathroom door is frosted so when the light is on in the bathroom, that light spills into the room and it woke me up. The view from the room was ok, facing st. patricks cathedral. fyi this hotel is also listed on tripadvisor under Manhattan Center Hotel. on the seventh floor there are three computers available to use, very handy and we never had to wait to use one. there is also free water available on every other floor. also if anything is happening at radio city music hall during your stay you'll be all up in the fun, the hotel is diagonally across from the stage door for radio city and we made our way through the crowd that was watching the red carpet for the SATC2 movie world premier. good place to stay if this is your first visit. Cons: -how the center of the bathroom door is frosted! -elevators can be slow when the hotel is busy

Reviews.Title: “All good for one night”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCatwoman
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel although nothing special. Smallish room but comfortable. Opened cupboard under the sink to find the last guests trash still there but we just closed the door! Paid $300 for 1 night on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable hotel in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: alandlisa
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in October 2009, found it to be very pleasant. As with many NYC hotels, you don't get a lot for space for your money but as we were out and about for most of the time it was just nice to have a base right in the middle of the city within quick walking distance of all the major attractions. The room was well furnished and had all the usual amenities expected. From the clientele that we saw, it would appear to be more of a business than leisure hotel however everyone was very pleasant and the staff very friendly. The best part for my partner was when we asked reception to order a taxi to the airport and a stretch white limousine turned up!!! Suffice to say were were very impressed if a little embarrassed!! This was at the same cost as a regular taxi! Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rhubarb29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from April 7 to 11, and it was a great experience. The room was clean and as quiet as it could be for being in midtown Manhattan, and the staff was friendly and accommodating. I got a package deal with the hotel through travelocity.com, and I was slightly anxious about it because I had never purchased anything through them before, but it was a great experience. The location is ideal, particularly for anyone interested in attending Broadway shows. The only complaint I have is that the TV was small and not that easy to see from the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperEagle78
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean hotel with all the basics and not bothered about luxuries this one is for you. Very reasonable prices, excellent location and nice rooms. My wife picked this hotel and I congratulated her for it!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Nice for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Alessandra19880
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was nice. The lobby was small but the front desk was very helpful when it came to checking in and out. They even let us keep our suitcases there until we left for the airport. A few things i didn't like were the small rooms, shower and the wait for the elevator. It seemed like we waited for 10 mins before it got to our floor which was the 11th. I also requested a queen bed but since i checked in a little early i got stuck with a double. So it was a little uncomfortable sleeping wise but nothing to complain about. I went with my boyfriend and had a amazing time, it was walking distance to everywhere, we went to the Top of the Rock which was amazing also. I would recommend this hotel only for a weekend stay though. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “average rooms, amazing location - that's what you're paying for”
Reviews.Author: Riazat
Reviews.Content: It's a great location, really, for sightseeing and shopping. That's what you're paying for. My three night stay was $900 (incl tax but not including breakfast). The rooms are ok - not enough storage space for clothes, irritating A/C, meagre toiletries in the bathroom (no showercap???) but a roomy shower. Free bottled water (actually quite useful) and free ice (ditto). An ok fitness room (although there are a ton of sports clubs nearby). There is a restaurant and there are enough local restaurants that deliver and of course you're in New York so you can eat anything, anywhere. It felt anonymous. It didn't have personality and coming from One Washington Circle - see my earlier review - where the staff were friendly and genuine - this felt like just another Manhattan hotel, like a conveyor belt. OK breakfast for $11 (bagels/danish/croissants/fruit/cereal etc) or American breakfast for $16. Free high speed internet and wierd but free printing system (quite useful actually). This is fine if you're only planning to sleep and shower in the city (although you could probably pay less and be central and still get the same standard of amenities). I wouldn't choose to stay here myself but it was fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: DianeStein
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a last minute business trip to New York. We needed to be able to walk to the different places we needed to go and we didn't want to pay a lot of money. The hotel staff is very customer orientated, the rooms are clean and updated and you can walk to so many great restaurants. Our stay was great and if I need to come back then I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Economy hotel for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: USReviewer2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is designed primarily for business travelers. The rooms are small, modern, and contain just the essentials for a business stay. This is NOT a good hotel for families, but will work for couples. I would stay there again on my next business trip with a corporate discount. Pros - Central location â€“ Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, 5th Avenue. Really, this hotel is in a super location. - Free Internet in room - Friendly service with check-in and check-out - Relatively quiet during the day (if you are on a high floor) Cons - Bathroom door â€“ Several reviews mention the bathroom door. The bathroom door slides to shut. It has no lock and the center of the door is frosted glass. I assume the frosted glass is to make the bathroom appear larger, but those sharing a room may feel less privacy. Another problem I had with the door is that it would not stay shut. I would pull it closed and it would slide open on its own. Tip: I found that placing a pen between the door and the wall stopped the door from sliding open. - Bare bedding â€“ The bed only has 1 top / bottom sheet, 1 thin comforter, and two pillows. Donâ€™t expect plush bedding in this economy hotel. - Shower, no bathtub â€“ As other reviews stated, the hotel has a shower, not a bathtub / shower combo in each room. The shower has a tiled bottom, which mine showed signs of mildew (see attached photo). If I stayed again, I would bring flip flops to wear in the shower. The shower does not have a shower door, just a shower curtain. - No closet, just a cabinet â€“ My room included a cabinet with a rack and drawers. The cabinet was too small for a regular sized suitcase. The room also did not include a suitcase rack. - Maids â€“ The maids can be loud during room cleanup. If you are staying all day in your hotel room, be aware of this. Also, after I dropped 4 towels and 2 washcloths on the floor, I only received 2 towels and 1 washcloth after the room was cleaned. - TV channels â€“ Mostly business / news for the business traveler. - Noise from the city â€“ There can be a lot of noise from the city at night. If you stay here, try to get your room as high up as possible. Tips - You can eat breakfast for under $5 in Rockefeller Center. To get to the eateries, just go to the bottom of Anthropologie OR the building across the street. Where the eateries are located, there is also a drugstore if you forget to bring something on your trip. - When you check-in, ask for a city map. The city map contains some discounts to attractions and is helpful in navigating the city and using the subway. - The hotel can hold your bags for some time after you check-out. This is helpful if you still have some appointments or sightseeing to do before leaving the city. - If you are traveling in winter, please dress accordingly! It can be freezing in the city! Make sure you bring a hat, gloves, scarf, and a warm coat. If you forget these things, you can purchase from a street vendor or within Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “smaller than expected but great location”
Reviews.Author: smacks17
Reviews.Content: the room was extremely small.. barely big enough to add a rollaway bed.. so the pics are misleading. we had to ask if the "lobby" was in fact a lobby as it didn't even look like a hotel. that being said, the location is great. right across the street from rockefeller plaza and walking distance to everything. the only bad thing is the size of the room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lenaNicosia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Manhattan next to all the main sights and of course the shops. We had two rooms one on the 2nd (smoking) and the other on the 20th which was a bit inconvenient but as we arrived late in the afternoon we couldnt change rooms. I heard a lot of negative comments about the reception staff but in general they were very helpful. The rooms were smaller than what I expected but from what I gather this is the case iat most hotels in NYC. tOur toilet kept getting blocked, but this was fixed within five minutes of our call. The small kitchenette in room was and the free water on the 7th and 20th floor were great extras. As we were five persons with over ten bags the hotel arranged for us a limasone to take us to the airport (US$150.00) which solved all the problems of carrying bags and getting there in style. The diner (I think its called Tersea) is next to the hotel and is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “easiest location in nyc”
Reviews.Author: HFactorScotland
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, the location was excellent, easy walking distance to everything. Inital problem on check-in (partly ours) but the whole trip from then on was perfect. It was our first trip to the city and we Love, Love, Loved it, the location of this hotel was so great for getting around we walked everywhere, even in the snow! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “This place is going downhill fast...look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: JayInAZ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location on previous trips, and found it to be a great value in a great location. Recently, I stayed there in December and was very disappointed. The beds were horrible - a single mattress on a wooden platform - and they only had two pillows with hardly any stuffing. When I called to the front desk for more pillows, it took them over 2 hours to show up. My wife and I spent the night tossing and turning trying to get comfortable. She even tried sleeping on the floor! My mother (in the next room) was so uncomfortable that spent the night walking around manhattan till we checked out the next day and then slept in the car! Also, the Terrace restaurant tried to overcharge us on both occasions when we went there (once for drinks, and the next morning for breakfast), and even included 15% gratuity for a party of four. So, CHECK YOUR BILLS CAREFULLY. To top it all off, when I got my credit card statement 2 weeks later, they'd charged me for someone else's room in addition to my own. After DAYS of calling and being told to call back some other time, I finally got through to someone who was willing to help. She determined that the check-out kiosk had 'somehow kept my credit card information' AFTER I CHECKED OUT, and then added the next person's charges to my card.
